captions.text: (Facebook Text: Eddie Lee liked your photo)
(Facebook Text: Andy Chang commented on your post: "I love that place!")
I'm sorry.  Have we met before?
Yeah.  You were at Liz's party, right?
(Coffee shop employee's voice in the background: "Tall vanilla latte for Haley.")
(Jonah searches for Haley on Facebook and then finds his friend Liz Zhou)
Best friends since 1st grade!! - with Haley Wright
(Instagram Text: ujeanchoi mentioned you in a photo)
Right.  I've never had that actually.
Do you come here a lot?
Yeah, I like to come here to study.
Yeah, me too.  Maybe we can study together some time.
I'll just find you on Facebook?
How do I get in touch with you?
Ummm... You could ask me for my number?
(Twitter Text: mistahfu mentioned you in a tweet)
Hey, let me take a picture.
I rented your favorite movie.  Ready?
(Text:  Who's this girl you're always posting about?)
Hey, you missed the best part.
Ok.  Yeah, yeah, yeah.  Let's watch.  Let's watch.
(Facebook Text: Caroline H. Lee posted on your wall)
I think he's cheating on me.
I have like 34 likes on this photo.
Is there ever a time you're not on your stupid phone?
Jonah, whenever I'm with you, it always feels like you're somewhere else!
Haley, listen to me.  I'm sorry.
Haley, listen to me.  Look... just listen...
(Haley's voice mail:  Hey, this is Haley.  Leave a message.)
(Liz: you know Haley likes you right?)
(Liz: way to ruin a good thing)
(Vibrating Text Message:  Yo, you doing anything tonight?)
(Vibrating Text Message:  Let's hang out bro!)
(Facebook Text: Benjamin Lee mentioned you in a post)
Liz.  I need to ask you for a favor.
I wanted to show you something.
(Text:  Jonah would like to sincerely apologize.  Do you accept his request?)  <Big Accept button>
Yeah.  Do you want to sit?
(Text:  One of the coolest girls I've ever met)
(Text:  Studying is only fun when I'm with this girl)
(Text:  The sunset is the second best thing in this photo)
(Text: the Coupon is Valid for Jonah's UNDIVIDED Attention - Expires: NEVER)
Oh my god, Jonah, doesn't that phone cost like $800?
It was... It was supposed to be a cool move.
Just put it down, ok?  Put it down.
Yeah, that actually may be my mom.  So maybe you get it?
Hey guys, this is Eugene from the Jubilee Project.
We really hope you enjoyed watching Connected.
Please don't forget to subscribe to our YouTube channel.
Oh yeah, and if you want to buy a T-shirt you saw on the film, make sure you go to dgicstore.com and get one now.
We're also very excited to announce our first ever Jubilee Project Conference.
If you're interested in joining and signing up, go to jubileeproject.org/conference.  We'll see you there!

title: Connected ft. Chris Dinh | A Jubilee Project Short Film

comments.text:
It's because these people are exposed to tech at such a young age that they 
don't fully develop the skills to interact with others due to lack of 
exposure. It's way easier to text and chat because you don't have to 
decipher another persons immediate response. It's lazy and you don't 
develop the confidence to interact with others.

Nice short. Chis is one of my fave tubers.﻿

comments.author: Jieun Park

comments.text:
It doesn't take much to be present. Sometimes we're too busy documenting 
the moments we aren't present enough to enjoy them. Things that are meant 
to keep us "connected" has begun to disconnect us from those we're trying 
to hold on to the most. 

Be present, be connected.

Hold hands... not phones...

SHOUTOUTtoJUBILEEproject﻿

comments.author: Munkhtsetseg Bayarmagnai

comments.text:
Have you ever watched 'The Anti-Social Network'? It is basically the exact 
same as this. A guy meets a girl, the girl gets sick of him always being on 
social media, and the girl eventually gets sick of it and leaves the guy, 
only to have the guy give up social media to be with the girl. That summary 
can be for either short film, but do you want to know the difference 
between the two? 'The Anti-Social Network' came out in July of 2013, but 
'Connected' came out in April of 2014. I'm not exactly saying it was 
copied, because who am I to know, but there's a possibility that it was. 
For all I know, it could just be the whole 'Hunger Games'/ 'Battle Royale' 
situation. Basically, all I'm saying is make sure your idea is original if 
you plan to be credited for it.﻿
